newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU energy tax plan may be discussed next week.
newsitem.headline: EU energy tax plan may be discussed next week.

text.p: The European Commission's plan to increase minimum taxation of oil products and extend it to electricity and natural gas may be discussed again next week, Commission officials said on Tuesday.
Commission spokesman Klaus van der Pas told a news briefing the proposal would be discussed at an upcoming Commission meeting, "probably on March 12".
The proposal was on the agenda for this week, but the top aides of the EU's 20 commissioners agreed on Monday to postpone it due to a lack of agreement.

The chief of cabinet of commissioner Mario Monti, who is responsible for the EU's single market and taxation policy, demanded more time to "make changes" to the text, Commission spokesman Patrick Child also told Reuters.
Child added there was "no problem as to the proposal's substance". He gave no details on the changes.
But other Commission sources say that many in the EU executive are concerned that the move will harm Europe's industrial competitiveness on the world's market.
The Commission's draft foresees an increase in the EU's minimum tax on motor diesel from a current 245 European currency units to 393 Ecus in 2002.
EU finance ministers, which must agree unanimously on the plan for it to become law, are expected to discuss the proposal at their next scheduled meeting on March 17.
